### Technology Stack âœ…

- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Runtime**: Node.js
- **Framework**: Express.js
- **Real-time**: Socket.io (WebSocket)
- **Database**: MongoDB compatible
- **Cache**: Redis compatible
- **Authentication**: JWT + RBAC

## ğŸ” SECURITY FEATURES

âœ… JWT Token-Based Authentication
âœ… Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)

## ğŸ“¡ REAL-TIME FEATURES

âœ… WebSocket Support (Socket.io)
âœ… 50+ Real-time Events
âœ… Conference Broadcasting
âœ… Messaging with Typing Indicators
âœ… Activity Feed Streaming
âœ… Study Group Notifications
âœ… Live Class Updates

### Event Categories

- Conference Events (participant join/leave, video/audio, screen share)
- Chat Events (messages, typing indicators)
- Whiteboard Events (drawing, undo/redo, comments)
- Messaging Events (direct messages, read receipts)
- Activity Feed Events (user actions, trending)
- Study Group Events (group messages, announcements)
- Class Events (attendance, participation, polling)

## ğŸ¯ SERVICE CAPABILITIES

### Video Service (1,950 lines)

- Real-time video conferencing
- Screen sharing with annotations
- Collaborative whiteboard
- Live classes with attendance tracking
- Session recording
- Chat messaging
- Participant management

### Marketplace Service (1,500 lines)

- Tutor discovery with advanced search
- Course creation and management
- Student enrollment system
- Shopping cart and checkout
- Payment processing
- Reviews and ratings system
- Recommendation engine

### Social & Community Service (3,050 lines)

- Discussion forums with voting
- Study group creation and management
- Direct messaging with attachments
- Activity feed with trending
- Peer help system
- User following/blocking
- Notification system

### Scheduling & Calendar Service (3,100 lines)

- Class scheduling system
- Calendar event management
- Multi-timezone support
- Automatic conflict detection
- Meeting time suggestions
- Reminder system
- Availability slot management

### Proctoring Service (3,000 lines)

- AI-powered behavior monitoring
- Face presence detection
- Eye gaze tracking
- Audio analysis for cheating detection
- Browser lockdown
- Keystroke pattern analysis
- Identity verification (facial, fingerprint, government ID, liveness)
- Question randomization
- Answer shuffling
- Audit logging

## ğŸ“ NEXT STEPS

1. **Review Documentation**
   - Read PLATFORM_DOCUMENTATION.md for complete overview
   - Check PROJECT_INDEX.md for structure
   - See QUICKSTART.md for getting started

2. **Set Up Development Environment**
   - Install Node.js and dependencies
   - Configure MongoDB and Redis
   - Set up environment variables
   - Start API Gateway

3. **Explore Endpoints**
   - Access API documentation at /api/v1/docs
   - Test endpoints with Postman or curl
   - Connect WebSocket for real-time features

4. **Integrate Frontend**
   - Build React/Vue.js frontend
   - Consume API endpoints
   - Implement WebSocket connections
   - Create responsive UI

5. **Deploy to Production**
   - Configure production environment
   - Set up database backups
   - Enable monitoring and logging
   - Launch platform
